title: Rapid formation of Nε-(carboxymethyl) lysine (CML) from ribose depends on glyoxal production by oxidation

N ε-(carboxymethyl) lysine (CML) is a major advanced glycation end-product (AGE) involved in protein dysfunction and inflammation in vivo. Its accumulation increases with age and is enhanced with the pathogenesis of...
